DataElement.preferredName: Food or Food Substance Product Material Or Class Substitution Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A substance consumed by humans and animals for nutritional purposes. EXAMPLE(S): broccoli, donuts, pet treats A coded value specifying a group of products that are homogeneous or generally considered as substitutes for each other. The class is considered as narrow or broad depending on how substitutable the various products are. EXAMPLE(S): stents, breakfast cereals, cox-2 inhibitors.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Food or Food Substance Product Material Or Class Substitution Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Processed or unprocessed substances obtained from animal, plant, microorganism and mining source that provide nutrients for living organisms to maintain biological processes or functions.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:The act of putting one thing or person in the place of another.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Food or Food Substance Product Material
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Processed or unprocessed substances obtained from animal, plant, microorganism and mining source that provide nutrients for living organisms to maintain biological processes or functions.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Concepts.definition: Processed or unprocessed substances obtained from animal, plant, microorganism and mining source that provide nutrients for living organisms to maintain biological processes or functions.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Property.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:The act of putting one thing or person in the place of another.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.
The act of putting one thing or person in the place of another.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
